Bennet.Overview: Michael Bennet would increase individual and corporate income taxes for high-income taxpayers and corporations. He would expand the child tax credit, the earned income tax credit, and the premium tax credit and create a new tax credit for home purchases. He would increase tax incentives to use zero-emissions vehicles and public transit. His plan would also force big banks to pay a financial risk fee.

Biden.Overview: Joe Biden would increase income and payroll taxes for high-income individuals and corporations, expand the earned income tax credit and the premium tax credit, create a new renter’s tax credit, and enhance incentives to save for retirement and purchase homes. He would eliminate tax preferences for fossil fuels and increase tax incentives to use energy-efficient technologies. His plan would also force big banks to pay a financial risk fee.

Booker.Overview: Cory Booker would increase income taxes for wealthy individuals and corporations, boost the estate tax, expand the earned income tax credit, and create a tax credit for low- and middle-income renters. He would eliminate tax preferences for fossil fuels, impose a carbon fee, and increase tax incentives to use energy-efficient technologies.

Bullets: Restore corporate income tax rates to their [levels before the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act](https://corybooker.com/issues/economic-security-and-opportunity/opportunity-and-justice-for-workers/)
Eliminate [tax preferences for fossil fuels](https://corybooker.com/issues/climate-change-environmental-justice/)
[Impose a penalty](https://corybooker.com/issues/health-care/) on drug companies that raise prices under certain circumstances
Allow certain small-business owners to [offer and participate in cafeteria benefit plans](https://www.congress.gov/bill/116th-congress/house-bill/593/text#toc-H32FE7879490E485685EE73E91AFECA94)
[Lift the minimum dollar amount](https://www.congress.gov/bill/116th-congress/house-bill/593/text#toc-H32FE7879490E485685EE73E91AFECA94) for filing a 1099-MISC to the IRS from $600 to $1,500
Align the deadlines for [quarterly tax payments](https://www.congress.gov/bill/116th-congress/house-bill/593/summary/00) for self-employed workers with calendar quarters
Allow net earnings below the quarterly Social Security coverage requirement to be [excluded from self-employment income](https://www.congress.gov/bill/116th-congress/house-bill/593/summary/00)

Make existing tax credits for renewable energy and energy efficiency [refundable, and extend them to 2030](https://corybooker.com/issues/climate-change-environmental-justice/corys-plan-to-address-the-threat-of-climate-change/)

Allow self-employed individuals to [deduct certain health insurance costs](https://www.congress.gov/bill/116th-congress/house-bill/593/text#toc-H32FE7879490E485685EE73E91AFECA94) when determining the amount of Social Security tax they owe
